STEPS.title: Make the Dough
STEPS.desc: Mix the starter, water, oil, and honey together. Mix these ingredients together and then add flour and salt. Once finished, cover the mix and let it rest for an hour.

STEPS.title: Stretch-N-Fold (Set 1)
STEPS.desc: Wet your hands before grabbing dough. Grab one side in a large bowl, then gently fold the dough over itself. Repeat this 3 times, rotating the bowl a quarter before folding. You'll need to do this roughly 4-6 times (recommended) spaced 30 minutes apart.

STEPS.title: Stretch-N-Fold (Set 2)
STEPS.desc: Wet your hands before grabbing dough. Grab one side in a large bowl, then gently fold the dough over itself. Repeat this 3 times, rotating the bowl a quarter before folding. You'll need to do this roughly 4-6 times (recommended) spaced 30 minutes apart.

STEPS.title: Stretch-N-Fold (Set 3)
STEPS.desc: Wet your hands before grabbing dough. Grab one side in a large bowl, then gently fold the dough over itself. Repeat this 3 times, rotating the bowl a quarter before folding. You'll need to do this roughly 4-6 times (recommended) spaced 30 minutes apart.

STEPS.title: Stretch-N-Fold (Set 4)
STEPS.desc: Wet your hands before grabbing dough. Grab one side in a large bowl, then gently fold the dough over itself. Repeat this 3 times, rotating the bowl a quarter before folding. You'll need to do this roughly 4-6 times (recommended) spaced 30 minutes apart.

STEPS.title: Bulk Ferment
STEPS.desc: Cover and rest the bowl for roughly 4-8 hours (minimum.) You can also leave it covered overnight.

STEPS.title: Shape Dough
STEPS.desc: Essentially, gently shape the dough into a ball shape. This helps to build surface tension that traps gases and creates a strong crust. This is accomplished by repeatedly rotating the dough and folding it towards it center. Once finished, place the dough in a greased loaf pan.

STEPS.title: Second Rise
STEPS.desc: Cover the bread and let it rise for roughly 2 hours.

STEPS.title: Preheat Oven (400 degs.)
STEPS.desc: You'll need to cover the dough before placing in the oven. The best way to do this is with a second loaf pan placed on top of the pan containing the dough.

STEPS.title: Bake Bread, 400 degs. (covered)
STEPS.desc: Bake the bread for 30 minutes with the bread covered.

STEPS.title: Bake Bread, 375 degs. (uncovered)
STEPS.desc: Remove the covering and lower the temperature inside the oven to 375 degrees Fahrenheit. Bake for another 15 minutes.

STEPS.title: Cool Bread
STEPS.desc: Remove the bread from the pan. Allow it to cool. Enjoy your beautiful bread!
